custom_fields.key_topics: This course discusses the role, functions and technical foundations of enterprise systems with special focus on Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) systems. Through hands-on use of enterprise systems in multiple case studies, the students will obtain practical knowledge on how to use such systems to run end-to-end business processes. The course also addresses the lifecycle of selecting, implementing, operating and maintaining enterprise systems as well as other advanced topics in that field. In addition to ERP, other types of enterprise systems will be covered such as Customer Relationship Management (CRM) and Supply Chain Management (SCM) systems. All registered students will be able to use real ERP software for hands-on exercise and homework.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: 67-272 is a prerequisite for this course unless otherwise approved by the instructor. Junior and Senior students are suitable for enrolment.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Assessments in the course typically include homework assignments (practical case studies), exams, quizzes, and graded in classwork.
custom_fields.goals: On the successful completion of this course, students will be able to1 Explain the role, value, and architecture and the different types of enterprise systems2 Describe key processes in organizations and how enterprise systems support them3 Explain the integrated business processes in SAP ERP systems4 Demonstrate working knowledge of SAP ERP systems to execute the key steps in various business processes and to extract meaningful information about these processes5 Explain the lifecycle of selecting, implementing, and operating enterprise systems
custom_fields.relevance: This course introduces students to the most important enterprise systems in organizations such as Enterprise Resource Planning and Customer Relationship Management systems
custom_fields.learning_resources: Textbooks, online resources, Software systems such as ERP/CRM
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: This is a 9 units course. On average, a student is expected to spend 9 hours a week on this course, consisting of 3 hours in class and 6 hours of self-study.

long_desc: Enterprise systems are the trend of software today in the industry. By integrating various functions of an enterprise, Enterprise systems improve the performance of business processes.  This course discusses role and function of Enterprise resource planning ERP systems how they fit into an organization analyzing business processes and ERP implementation the ethical, global and security issues of ERP implementation handon use of ERP software ERP vendors and industry trends are also studied.   Software practice and ERP case analysis are required. Prereq of 67272 or permission of instructor.
name: Enterprise Systems: Concepts and Practice
